title: Apple will require app devs to explain exactly why they use certain APIs
description: Some seemingly innocuous APIs are misused to track users, Apple says.

title: Google’s RT-2 AI model brings us one step closer to WALL-E
description: "First-of-its-kind" robot AI model can recognize trash and perform complex actions.

title: Reddit calls for “a few new mods” after axing, polarizing some of its best
description: Will Reddit get quality replacements? "Not a snowball's chance in hell."

title: Android malware steals user credentials using optical character recognition
description: OCR isn't the only advanced technique used by "CherryBlos" apps.

title: This company keeps selling TB-tainted bone grafts, causing deadly outbreaks
description: In the last outbreak, at least 87 people had signs of tuberculosis after spinal surgery.

title: Samsung’s profits are down 95 percent for a second consecutive quarter
description: Samsung is still suffering under a glut of unsold memory chips.

title: Devs aren’t allowed to let Apple’s Vision Pro dev kits out of their sight
description: Dev kits often have restrictive terms, but Vision Pro is above and beyond.

title: Most of the 100 million people who signed up for Threads stopped using it
description: "We're seeing more people coming back daily than I'd expected," Zuckerberg said.

title: NASA temporarily loses contact with one of its most distant spacecraft
description: The Voyagers were launched nearly half a century ago.

title: The milk float was the first truly successful last-mile delivery EV
description: Last-mile delivery EVs are in hot demand in 2023, but they're nothing new.

title: Apple Pencils can’t draw straight on third-party replacement iPad screens
description: It's similar to the Face ID failures of the iPhone 13's screen, later fixed.

title: Did Facebook fuel political polarization during the 2020 election? It’s complicated.
description: There's strong ideological segregation, but proposed interventions didn't change attitudes.

title: Increasing levels of humidity are here to make heat waves even worse
description: This summer's heat is only a preview of what's in store for our future.

title: Getting TIE Fighter: Total Conversion working is worth the hassle and the $10
description: It has a 1999 engine, 2021 graphics, and that unmistakable '90s LucasArts feel.

title: Formula E’s first visit to a proper American racetrack saw packed stands
description: We found a lot to be optimistic about for the all-electric racing series.

title: Rocket Report: Starbase comes alive again; China launches four times
description: Maybe the next Starship launch isn't all that far off.

title: AMD Ryzen 7945X3D could be a fast, super-efficient choice for your new gaming laptop
description: The chip is only launching in a single laptop from Asus, at least for now.
